summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of FoundersLib UI/UX refactoring with smallest.ai inspired design. All major UI components working correctly with excellent dark theme, glassmorphism effects, and responsive design. Backend testing not possible due to missing backend implementation.

critical_bugs.issue: Backend directory and server.py file do not exist in the project
critical_bugs.impact: Cannot test API functionality, authentication, or data persistence

missing_components.impact: All API calls will fail, authentication won't work

integration_issues.issue: Theme toggle button clicks but visual changes not immediately apparent
integration_issues.note: Theme preference is stored in localStorage but visual feedback could be improved

passed_tests: Landing page renders correctly with all sections (hero, platform, workflow, reviews, security, CTA)
Navigation buttons work (Sign in, Get Started)
Login page renders with proper glassmorphism styling and form fields
Signup page renders with all form fields including role selection (founder, investor, both)
Dark theme styling with cyan/violet accents implemented correctly
Authentication system properly redirects unauthenticated users
Mobile responsive design works correctly on 390x844 viewport
All interactive elements have proper data-testid attributes for testing
Form fields are accessible and functional
Glassmorphism effects and backdrop-blur styling implemented
Typography uses modern fonts (Space Grotesk, Manrope)
CSS custom properties for theming are properly configured
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Backend implementation is completely missing. Need to create /app/backend/ directory with FastAPI server, authentication endpoints, and database integration. Current frontend expects API at localhost:8000/api/v1 but no backend exists. All API calls will fail until backend is implemented.
